that to figure out why most Americans
are stuck with twoe pay
we have to go back in time way back when
people didn't even use
money no back then you hand it over your
chickens and boom you got a cow no
waiting around nice cow man but as
economies grew things begin to change
stores got bigger and Retail boomed with
the Industrial Revolution small
businesses turned into factories the
factories needed workers lots of them to
save time bosses started paying everyone
at the end of the week convenient for
them but not so much for the workers
then World War II hit and the government
needed money to fund the war and prevent
inflation so they started taking more
money out of workers pay to cover these
costs workers demanded pay slips to keep
a record of what they were earning or
what they weren't earning but these pay
slips created more paperwork for the
bosses each week so to lighten the load
many companies decided to start paying
people every two
weeks fast forward about 100 years and
here we are
today so these pay schedules were
created with the needs of companies in
mind now
workers bi-weekly pay basically means
you're giving your boss an interest free
loan on your labor and when your bills
don't line up with payday you're left
waiting for your money this helps
explain why almost 40% of Americans were
charged with late fees in the last year
in fact in recent years banks have made
up to $14 billion annually in late fees
alone and it's not just about the fees
with this outdated pay schedule you can
miss out on deals and other
opportunities like that flight on sale
if you wait till payday those prices
will only have gone up the bottom line
our pay Cycles are the results of the
outdated system that puts the needs of
businesses before the workers but while
your pay schedule might be stuck in the
past new routes like my pay from chime
are available today to give you more
control over your money my pay lets you
get up to $500 with your pay before
payday so you get paid when you say
giving you more ways to handle whatever
life throws at you and jump on timely
deals and that's something we can all
get on board with
